website_summaries.verdict: Tin case of 72 soft-core pencils for blending, shading, and layering. Softer and waxier than regular pencils. A top brand in colored pencils.
pros: Color coded for easy identification of pencils
Durable box stores soft, waxy pencils securely
You can create beautiful work with vibrant, smooth pigments
cons: Some leads uneven or not numbered clearly

customer_reviews.title: Qality
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect that it will be such a big difference between Prismacolor and different brand pencils... They are very smooth and quality is just amazing! First photo different brand, second prismacolor pencils.
customer_reviews.author: Rosita

customer_reviews.title: Prismacolor Set- make sure its geniune
customer_reviews.text: Buyers Beware! Make sure that when you buy this item, it’s fulfilled by Amazon.com or by a trusted reseller. I bought a set from a new reseller and it didn’t looked right so I bought one again, this time fulfilled by Amazon. I am very happy with the Amazon.com set. The new reseller’s set is fake! Look at the difference between the two sets!- The size, graphic print and actual quality of the cans, and how the pens are arranged when you first open the box.
customer_reviews.author: Lynx

customer_reviews.title: FAKES
customer_reviews.text: I love Prismacolor colored pencils but these that I received were FAKES. Not real Prismacolor pencils. I compared the ones a already had and they don’t even have the same formula when used on paper. I’m extremely disappointed. I returned them immediately. I added a video of two pencils that are supposed to be the same color. The one on the left is the REAL one I bought in store and the one on the right is the FAKE one I got in this pack.
customer_reviews.author: JuliaLove45

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Received these pencils today; I’ve been looking for a wax based go too because I normally use oil based pencils. I like the color selection, and the pigment layout. However, there are duplicates, there are off center leads, there are pencils split down the side, so I would say buyer beware. I would also like to add that I don’t know why the box of 72 that I used to buy cost 40$ last year, and is now 70$. I see no improvement in quality, so I can only conclude this is price gouging.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Gee

customer_reviews.title: Pencil color is off the chart
customer_reviews.text: Bought from Amazon for my daughter's art class, instructor told me it's fake products, I could not believe it until he did side by side comparison of those two, he showed me the color yellow there were complete different, same number and the pencil core feels not soft enough. The instructor is pro and won many competition in US, I was shocked to learn the truth and completely and deeply sorry to the see what happened, I wish Amazon can do better quality control on the products sold on their website.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Fake product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This seller's Prismacolor color pencil set did not perform as well as the actual set. We bought two with one of them arriving damaged. The "prismacolor" box had a misspelling on the back; instead of "soft" it wrote "saft". The pencils itself released a bad odor and did not perform at all like the original!
customer_reviews.author: AlexZ

customer_reviews.title: Good product, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with the quality of these pencils. I would expect much more from something that I spend so much money on. When I received them and opened the tin many of the pencils were warped, and the casing is of very poor quality.( Pictured is one of the warped pencils next to a straight one) It is quite a shame because I do really like the pencils I am just very upset about the quality.
customer_reviews.author: rongstadfamily

customer_reviews.title: Low quality when compared with old prismacolors
customer_reviews.text: I swatched out these new prismacolor premier pencils and compared them with my old Berol and Sanford prismacolor pencils. The old ones have tons more pigment; the new ones have way more wax. Also the barrel of these new ones are much thinner. They don't even feel good going down on the paper. They aren't creamy or buttery like my older ones. I'm not sure that these are any better quality than my Crayolas. I'm so disappointed in the low quality of a brand that used to be great, a brand I used to trust. Unfortunately, Amazon doesn't offer a return on these which is also a disappointment and reminds me to be careful of what I purchase on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: K. Griffes

customer_reviews.title: Pencils contain irritant
customer_reviews.text: The pencil collection contains everything pictured: three layers of varying shades of primary and secondary colors. However, while using the pencils, my eyes watered, my throat itched, and my sinuses burned. There must be some kind of toxic dust from the factory in the box, or the pencils themselves are made from irritating materials. Once I put the lid back on the box and the box back in the cupboard my nose stopped burning and my throat stopped itching. I am very disappointed in this product and wish I could return it since using it causes discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: D Blem

customer_reviews.title: Returning this ASAP
customer_reviews.text: Product does not look authentic. I bought a 48 piece set about 2 years ago and now need a new set. I bought the 72 piece set and they appear to be so different that I am doubting the authenticity of the new set. In the picture I am holding blush pink color. The one on the left is my old set and the one on the right is the new one that just arrived today. The left one(Old pencil) has a bigger or thicker lead. I tried them both and the colors are not the same. I am returning this and will probably buy one from Michael’s.
customer_reviews.author: keroleen

customer_reviews.title: Way too messy
customer_reviews.text: I tried to like these pencils but they were way too messy for my liking. The color will get all over your fingers when you try to clean the pencil dust off of the page. And you’ll probably smear the color into other areas of the picture. I got so frustrated with them I threw an almost unused set into the garbage. Bought some markers instead. Much more fun to color with!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong colors/wrong numbering!
customer_reviews.text: The colors are supposed to be artist quality, meaning they have a strict formula making them consistent between batches and aligning with the light fast testing that is conducted. However, this particular boxes colors did not match any of my class mates pencils in color when compared by the ID number. The entire box of 72 pencils were mislabeled or miscolored!! I am in the middle of a class and can’t be without something, but my work isn’t aligning with my assignments. Very frustrating! 😣
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Wont purchase these from here,
customer_reviews.text: I have been doing adult colorbooks for a couple years now and purchased this box over 4 times and this box is either mis-boxed or labeled because they do not look the same as in the colors as well as they do not lay down and blend as the ones Iv previously bought, I dont recomend these if you have indeed used them before these seem like they are generic. I wont buy them here again, to costly for fake products
customer_reviews.author: Cindylee

customer_reviews.title: Love these... But...
customer_reviews.text: These are great blending pencils. As of now they are twice what I paid less than a year ago. I think they're great for experienced artists. However, if you are new to this "adult coloring" wave, get the Prismacolor Verithin, not the Premiere. They're closer to what you'd expect. These are soft and will not give you what you want if you aren't experienced with colored pencils.
customer_reviews.author: A Wife, Mom, JediTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: 2nd or 3rd quality artist pencils - company standards not met
customer_reviews.text: It seems these are seconds or from a manufactured lot that was not up to company standards and are now discounted for a quick sale. Buyer beware - the color portion inside the wooden pencil breaks everytime u use any pencil. If u sharpen them they break even quicker and yes i am using an artists sharpener. It is quit disappointing that they break all the time - I am sure these are very good pencils. Now my contractural work is somewhat delayed.
customer_reviews.author: milo 1512

customer_reviews.title: Find a better brand. Quality here is awful!
customer_reviews.text: Prisma pencils used to be my go-to for quality color. However, the last few sets I have ordered, this one included, have been terrible! The quality has gone WAY down hill!! I've used this brand for 20+ years...and suddenly I find myself constantly having to sharpen them. The cores are all crumbled inside them, upon delivery. Several pencils had the leads broken when I removed the plastic wrapping from the tin and removed the lid FOR THE FIRST TIME!!
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Lead is shattered in some pencils
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive these as I have just recently got into art and wanted to try my hand at coloring so I ordered these. The tin was damaged on arrival, it was dented in on one corner so I did my best to shape it back into place. Then I noticed on a few ( not all) of the pencils when I sharpened them the lead bay shattered inside. I couldn't get one of the pinks to hold the lead until about 1/3 of sharpening the pencil, its really frustrating :/
customer_reviews.author: sean klose

customer_reviews.title: The Best Artists’ Quality Colored Pencils
customer_reviews.text: I have been creating with Prismacolor Premier colored pencils for many years. In my opinion they are the highest quality colored pencils available for professionals. I particularly like using them for the burnishing technique. I originally tried them at the recommendation of a very talented artist friend who used them to paint portraits that look like photos. For anyone who is thinking, “Painting with pencils?” Yes, the final result is called a painting even though paint is not involved. These pencils are very versatile. They work well for many techniques. I recently purchased some from Amazon and was very pleased with the condition they arrived in. The tins are sturdy and a nice way to store the pencils.
customer_reviews.author: Creative Order

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I want to love these SOO MUCH, however they keep coming to me with broken leads and split wood. :( it gets to be such a hassle to return and these are NOT cheap!! I'm not sure if it's a packaging problem or a quality problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They were fake
customer_reviews.text: They were fake, all of them, the front of the tin was dark, I'd never heard of fake Prismacolor pencils before, now I know what to look for l.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: We got two Fake Copies that not drawing well.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this. They do not draw color out well. It is fake and cheap version of the real ones. We(all of our drawing class, many kids) have to buy the more expensive ones. BTW we ordered two boxes 5/16/2019.
customer_reviews.author: Yang Zhao

customer_reviews.title: Sad and disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to finally see these went on sale so when I opened the box and realized the Prismacolor tin case holding the pencils was completely bent and it was missing a bunch of pencils I was so upset! Plus some pencils on one tray were broken at the tip. I'm a very loyal Prime customer and would like a new set sent to me or Amazon credit. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Pencils are not the same as if you were to purchase at Michaels or Hobby Lobby, etc. Thin and keeps breaking especially when trying to sharpen. Will never buy this product on Amazon again. Will go to Michael's or Hobby Lobby. DO NOT BUY! VERY DISSATISFIED!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Keller

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: After my last poor experience with this brand (cracked pencils, broken leads and poorly centered cores), I decided to give them another chance because some reviews mentioned they fixed those issues. Sadly, they have not. At least 10 of the pencils were cracked and many of the cores were off center. They are almost impossible to sharpen, even with their sharpener. Derwent coloursoft are much better, so I'll go back to them, even though their color range is thin (72 colors). I guess I'll need to keep looking for an affordable quality soft colored pencil with a large range of colors.
customer_reviews.author: lynn a morris

customer_reviews.title: FAKES! do NOT buy.
customer_reviews.text: These are 100% FAKE. I've added a photo of one example.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: Some pencils have uncentered cores
customer_reviews.text: I love how the pencils create vibrant colors, really soft and creamy, blends beautifully BUT its such a drama sharpening these pencils, and some of the pencil cores from the pack I got were uncentered which adds up to the dilemma...electric sharpeners are a must to reduce breakage during sharpening however with uncentered cores, even electric sharpeners cant do much...another thing that I noticed is the tin can isnt a snug fit with the pencil casing that come along with it..therefore..the pencils are prone to bouncing inside the tin which potentially breaks the cores inside..seems like the manufacturer needs to pay attention to these details
customer_reviews.author: cheryl villamor

customer_reviews.title: What is the deal?
customer_reviews.text: I’m an art teacher, artist, and a huge fan of Prismacolor. I got this set and noticed that a few colors (most notably Crimson Red) are completely off from other sets that I’ve purchased from art supply stores in the past year. Also, at least one of the pencils was completely missing lead. I’m assuming these are real, but now I’m wondering if the price was too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Aindy

customer_reviews.title: Love my upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I first bought the 24 set a year ago then upgraded to 48 set months ago which is a decent size but I upgraded again. I love the 72 set. More colors allow for unique shading and coloring techniques. I love this set and hopefully will stay with this sized set (still might get the 150 set later on). Nice mix of each color range. I organize my colors by yellows (and oranges), reds (and pinks), blues (and violets), greens, browns and neutrals. Each range offers over 10 colors creating a healthy and lively palette.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: Package discrepancies
customer_reviews.text: I received these in the middle of July. I did not open them until last week. When I put them in my color book there were a lot of things wrong. 3 of them had a split barrel, 4 had the same color number as some others but totally different colors. Some would hardly color and some were so waxy they would smear. I know it is too late to do anything about them but you might want to check on some that you have in stock and see if they are the quality you have always had.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Baggett

customer_reviews.title: Colors good, pencils terrible
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE these. The color is so even and so easily blended together. They were $70 at one of the craft store chains so it's really a steal. It's taken my drawing and adult coloring to the next level. Highly recommend.- this was my review before about every other pencil I sharpened fell apart and crumbled every time I sharpened it. The colors are great but I can't use half of them. Idk if this is an amazon problem or a prismacolor problem but that's a lot of money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Scott

customer_reviews.title: Item NOT Prismacolor.... generic Chinese brand.  BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: The advertisement presents Prismacolor Brand Pencils. The actual pencils are generic-brand and NOT Prismacolor. Bought for a birthday and am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: TimberNJosh

customer_reviews.title: I think it's a waste of money and do not recommend these for anyone
customer_reviews.text: Every time I go to sharpen these pencils, every single one, they break. They are all half size now, and I've barely used them. I think it's a waste of money and do not recommend these for anyone. They are crap. I'm highly disappointed :-( I was really looking forward to using them too.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Bananah

customer_reviews.title: They break easily
customer_reviews.text: They break really easily. I think they got busted around in shipping because I got a new sharpener to see if it was that and they still break bad. I'm not sure what to do because I can't use them without them breaking.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Fake product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is fake! We compared with product bought from art store side by side with the same color. Some colors are so off, and the quality for blending is obviously worse too! Rather pay more than buying fakes!
customer_reviews.author: Jiesi

customer_reviews.title: Always breaking
customer_reviews.text: The leads are shattered and the prismacolor pencil sharpener doesn't work for these. Had to throw lilac away immediately after using it once it was shattered all the way through.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These pencils make coloring more enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: In the past, I have used inexpensive colored pencils to use in adult coloring books. The results were always disappointing so I bought Prismacolor Premier colored pencils based on the advice of many of the tutorials on YouTube. My coloring experience has become more enjoyable as they allow me to blend, shade, and layer much easier and I'm very satisfied with them. I sharpen them with a Prismacolor pencil sharpener and have not had any breakage issues. I bought this particular set because the price had dropped temporarily which was a factor in my decision making; otherwise, I would have gone with a smaller set. Now that I have tried these pencils, they are my colored pencil of choice.
customer_reviews.author: Silvercoupe40

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these pencils along with the same brand of sharpener. These pencils break almost every time I sharpen them, they're no better for sharpening than all of the other cheap colored pencils. They color well, but they are far too expensive for the amount of pencil being lost to breakage.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Broken lead
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. The lead on almost every pencil is broken and I don’t find that out until I begin to use the color and try to sharpen the pencil. Initially I thought it was just a few pencils but it’s not.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Not really seeing the benefits of the higher price pencils.
customer_reviews.text: Having only used the 50 color Crayola product previously, I decided I wanted more colors and after spending a lot of time reading reviews spent the extra money on a set of these. I won't do it again. In my experience,​ not that much is gained in quality over the Crayolas. I have the sharpener made by Prismacolor as well, and I have as much trouble getting a fine point on these as I did with the Crayolas, and as much or more breakage while working. Maybe I need more instruction on proper usage, but for me, it will be cheap ones from now on.
customer_reviews.author: R. Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Prismacolor color pencils are AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for 8 years. I bought a small 24 pack 8 years ago via Amazon. KIds LOVED them. I use to goto Michael's Craft store and buy individual ones using either 40% off or 50% off coupons to replace a color OR get a new one. This time when seeing I saw that they this big set of 72 colored pencils for $25, because the top lid was bent in. I didn't care about that as I was going to put them into a nice colored pencil case. I got an awesome deal. My kids still enjoy using them.
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Prisma color Pencils are not made the same as the ones from 5 years ago, cores are to one side to the extreme edge when you sharpen they break More than 60 % are not in the center some are split in the side all the way down. Bad quality these are made in mexico
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: FAKE.  Do not buy if you care about quality.
customer_reviews.text: These are FAKE. NOT AUTHENTIC PRISMA. My daughter has a smaller set I purchased in a store. I thought these were such a great deal. Now I know why. Side by side, they don’t compare. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Smith Family

customer_reviews.title: My Travel Set
customer_reviews.text: Love the 72ct set. There’s enough color variety to take with me when working my EMS work shifts (to color between 911 calls) or when traveling without having to worry about taking my main set of prismacolor pencils with me and risk breaking or losing them. Love it! Great quality pencils as usual. I have found after reading many reviews to avoid sharpening these with the prismacolor pencil sharpener. I bought a cheap pencil sharpener at Hobby Lobby and have had a lot of success sharpening my pencils. Rarely do my pencils break when sharpening, which is a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Khudsontn

customer_reviews.title: color pencil is a fake
customer_reviews.text: This color pencil is completely different from that I bought in store, no matter color and stiffiness. My kid use these color pencil was hard to follow the teacher's request. Every time her pencil with same color number was obviously different with others. I contacted the seller one week ago but no body have replied. And the pencil's box is also different with others, and can be seen easily by eyes. Seller wastes my time and energy.
customer_reviews.author: Gang Chen

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed. I would not recommend these colored pencils
customer_reviews.text: These colored pencils were badly made, every single one the core were off center and they had to of been damaged, the wood casing was cracked and when you sharpen them they keep breaking. By the time they do get sharpened they were so small. I'm very disappointed. I would not recommend these colored pencils. The Favre cartel or Derwent colored pencils are better.
customer_reviews.author: LORIANN

customer_reviews.title: Big & Colorful - She Loved Her New Pencils!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a retired wife who likes "coloring." This brand seems expensive (about a buck a pencil), but the colors are exceptionally pure; far better quality compared to cheaper brands. If you want to gift "the good stuff," this is the brand to buy. She especially liked all the extra colors in the 72-pack, which was a big improvement over the smaller sets she had been buying at the big box store.
customer_reviews.author: PC-G

customer_reviews.title: So many broken leads mean pencils are already leas than half their size with little use
customer_reviews.text: So disappointing. I love Prismacolor pencils, hence the 3 stars, however these were incredibly disappointing due to the sheer quantity of broken leads. I have more than 8 pencils that have been used once or twice, each now less than half their original size due to consistent breakage. Of course, they are the colors I would otherwise have used more than most and now am unable. Some colors have not yet been used and others only briefly, so I fully anticipate the quantity of wasted pencils to increase. So, so disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Melcjm

customer_reviews.title: breaks every time I sharpen
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I started using these after the return date passed. Every time I sharpen (and I've tried different sharpeners) they break. I had another box of these and I loved them hence I bought another one. These are clearly faulty and I should be able to return them. The colors I have used are now sharpened down to a nub and I cannot use.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Prismacolor pencil review
customer_reviews.text: I have worked with Prismacolor pencils,artsticks,and all other Prismacolor products for years. I love them all. While Prismacolor had gone through changes in manufactering. The brand has remained consistant. Just for giggles I read some customer reviews. I read complaints about dissatisfaction. As far as sharpening it in itself is an art. It took me several years to master the technique. You must use a quality sharpener (never electric) and hold the pencil close to the barrel. The key is to sharpen SLOWLY. In regards to my purchase I cannot be more satisfied. Original Prismacolor packaging and product. I will buy again from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Don Lunsford

customer_reviews.title: Worth it but get brass sharpener instead
customer_reviews.text: They are amazing only thing I would add is that points break easily while sharpening after a while. The point gets dull and no amount of cleaning will do. Instead of using Prisma Sharpener it’s best to use brass pencil sharpener w replacement blades. I used Prisma sharpener and pint kept breaking before use and next I knew it was more than half gone. After ordering brass sharpener haven’t had any problems now only time points break is when I accidentally sit on them
customer_reviews.author: isolina aviles

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed because I thought that Prismacolor made the best quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Using the prismacolor manual sharpener I had no problems using or sharpening the first 8 or so colors I tried, but the core of the ultramarine colored pencil is laughably soft; I sharpened it down to half-size trying to get it sharp for the very first time before deciding it's definitely faulty. I had to break apart the tip that was left behind in the sharpener 6 times with a tiny needle; one single time I managed to get a tip on the pencil, and it crumbled the moment I touched it to the paper. The dark green pencil is also exceedingly soft. I'm very disappointed because I thought that Prismacolor made the best quality drawing utensils until now.
customer_reviews.author: John Wade

customer_reviews.title: c o l o r s f o r d a y s 😍
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, rich colors! The packaging was brand new, and I have received this product early, like I've literally gotten it the day after ordering it lol, due to a trusted seller that I know I can trust. Not only am I an artist, but I am also planning to use these colored pencils for my brand new adult coloring books that of which I've also received. Although some of the cores are indeed to be off-centered, that doesn't really bother me at all, since I know an easy fix for it. I will be ordering more of these again in the future, once this current set of 72 runs out! Definitely 5 out of 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: FAKE-DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY-THESE ARE FAKE The colors inside came in a random order as if they were just thrown in, and not colorized like in the photo, I found it really annoying.. Plus, the writing is different and I compared some of the same pencils to another box I already have and it is way less pigmented than the original and feels cheap
customer_reviews.author: Haileybh16

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this zero stars if I could. Pencil wore down immediately when coloring. As I went to sharpen it, with a prismacolor sharpener, it just kept getting smaller and smaller, and the tips kept falling out. Terrible quality, and what makes it worse, was it was not eligible for return. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: stacey l bock

customer_reviews.title: Great product - but watch-out for delivery, it could end-up in your neighbor's mailbox
customer_reviews.text: The order status saying "Delivered today, package was left inside the residence's mailbox", but the package is not there. Sorry for posting my issue here, but I couldn't find other places on the website or mobile app that could let me post the issue. I will revisit the review after things get updated. Updates: Eventually, the item end-up in my neighbor's mailbox, and the neighbor passed it to me. The product is good, exactly as described. It has a durable tin box to hold the pencils, a good extra storage for a high school student's daily usage.
customer_reviews.author: zxw

customer_reviews.title: Knock pffs
customer_reviews.text: Received these today. They are knock offs. I have the same set to compare these to and the colors are way different. I got a yellow that is brown, a red that is pink and all the colors differ from slightly to way different. I guess they’re still colored pencils so they will get the job done, but it makes it hard when they aren’t anything like the color they should be.
customer_reviews.author: Happydreaming

customer_reviews.title: The Best Color Pencils EVER....!
customer_reviews.text: These are my absolute favorite color pencils. The colors are so vibrant and bold. When coloring with these color pencils, they make whatever you’re coloring come to life. Only thing with these color pencils and it’s nothing bad because I have nothing bad to say about them, is you have to be careful with what type of sharpener you use to sharpen them because if you just use any ole cheap pencil sharpeners then your color pencils aren’t going to sharpen they’re just going to keep breaking off. But yes I definitely 100% recommend these color pencils to anyone who loves coloring or even drawing for that matter.
customer_reviews.author: tamtam1414

customer_reviews.title: Dreamy
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit I was hesitant to purchase these, considering the price and the fact that mostly I just color in coloring books, but these are phenomenal. Highly pigmented, soft so it doesn't leave that telltale irregularity when drawing on rougher papers. These are a dream. Like with cheaper pencils, however, the lead doesn't seem to match the pencil exactly, so making a chart can be helpful. I've actually been giving colored pages out as gifts because it looks like real art when I use these, and my friends and family love them.
customer_reviews.author: Gladys Finkelstein

customer_reviews.title: It's a shame
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted to like these. They go on smooth and the color is rich, but I simply can't look past the good quality of the wood. I don't know how one would use a hand held sharpener without cracking them completely! 2 of my pencils are cracked from nose to toes and another one came hollow. I've bought many many brands, but even the dollar store brands have better quality.
customer_reviews.author: L. B. Mercer

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite medium!
customer_reviews.text: I never liked colored pencils. The leads were too hard, and barely made any color on the paper no matter how hard you tried. Then my mother bought me a box of Prismacolored pencils. I never knew that there was such a thing as "artist quality coloring pencils"! Now I can't get enough of them. When that set wore out, I ordered an even bigger, fancier set. Yes, they are mind-boggling expensive for colored pencils, buy they are so worth every penny! They even sharpen to a point without breaking. The leads are soft, and blend so well...just try them out. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Russell

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These are OK, but I am disappointed because I almost feel like these aren't the real deal. I've used prisma for years and something is off about the ones I got. I don't know if prisma is skimping in quality now or what. They seem dryer and chalkier than others I've used in past. I almost feel like they are crayola brand just labled as prisma. Also they are awful when sharpening, they constantly break and just don't sharpen well in general. The quality just isn't art quality in these.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful set of colored pencils!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, quality set of Prismacolor pencils! I did end up buying the larger set, after this one, for more color choices, but use these colors quite a bit anyhow, so, now I have back up pencils! I'm an artist but I also use these for my coloring books~ They are lovely, soft & creamy colors (some aren't as soft than others, depends on the color), artist quality, but amazing for coloring books too. They come in a sturdy metal tin. My only issue with this is the thin, floppy plastic trays that hold the pencils, which easily bends, scattering fragile colored pencils all over (I may glue sturdy cardboard to the undersides of the trays, making them less floppy).
customer_reviews.author: MeTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH IT, worst pencil ever
customer_reviews.text: I really do not see what the hype is on these pencils. I have so many other brands that lay down color good, and do not break. The pencil tip was barely sharpened when I opened the pack, and they break when applying color, then started splitting when sharpened. A pencil that has this many good reviews and people rave about all over, but yet they aren't really living up to the hype in my opinion. i have used these only twice since I have gotten them, because they were such a big dissapointment. I wish I had never bought them and could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: Great price for this large set!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's art teacher recommended these. She has to take her own supplies to school this year (thanks, Covid) and she needed a new set of professional level pencils. She is over the moon with this kit! There are three layers of pencils, so everything fits nicely in the tin. Each layer seems sturdy enough to remove without getting the pencils all jumbled. My daughter is excited to have so many colors. At the local craft store, the pencils were a lot more expensive, even with their 40% off coupon. Overall, pleased with the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ranae

customer_reviews.title: I got a fake set from AMAZON!
customer_reviews.text: These are fake product. I compared with the one I bought years ago. These are much harder, not creamy, thinner core. THEY ARE FAKE PRODUCT.Amazon should not allow this fake product stay on line.
customer_reviews.author: NormB

customer_reviews.title: Color your World
customer_reviews.text: I always though prismacolor could never ever be possibly worth the price. I always thought colored pencils were too pale. I was wrong. Prismacolor changed my coloring world. I tried one out in a store and instantly fell in love. It colors so insanely smoothly. It feels more like coloring with a crayon because of how easy it goes on paper. The colors are vibrant. The name and number of the color is on each pencil. Sadly my tin came dented so getting them in and out of the container can be hard.
customer_reviews.author: Epic

customer_reviews.title: Still a very good pencil
customer_reviews.text: I heard a lot of of complaints about these pencils breaking when sharpening and the core being off center. After a bit of research I discovered these pencils are no longer produced in the US they come from Mexico and they don't have the quality control the former pencil did. This becomes a problem when sharpening because the core will get misshapen and break and crumble. All that said they can be purchased rather inexpensive compared to other high quality pencils. They shade layer and blend well. There are other. bands more expensive that are higher quality . Just one woman's opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not smooth. Difficult to do anything beyond light shading. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I waited too late to try to return this. The pencils aren’t smooth. It’s difficult to do anything more than a light shading. Trying to vibrantly color an area and make the color more opaque and deep just isn’t achievable. Total waste of money. I’m very disappointed. I wish that I could return them. I couldn’t even make it through one coloring page because it was just too disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Dr B

customer_reviews.title: For the price they aren’t bad. BUT they aren’t the real thing
customer_reviews.text: For the price they aren’t bad, BUT they aren’t the real thing. I have the real ones already to compare it to. The core is smaller and the colors aren’t the same. For example I can compare my original gold colored pencil to the one they sent and they are two very different shades of gold even though if you look at what is written on the pencil it should be the same. You can see this in the pictures. The one on top with the black writing is the original pencil while the one on the bottom is the one ordered from here. The blenability isn’t as good as well but not aweful.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Would by this brand again and again.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a budding artist and she LOVES these pencils! I cannot even remember how many brands we have gone through, but these are her favorites. She loves the color saturation, blendability & how smooth the color transfers to paper. I love the metal box they come in. She is so hard on her belongings & this has protected the pencils through a lot of harsh transports.
customer_reviews.author: Verona Maria Chudy

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if I got a bad batch or what
customer_reviews.text: First let me preface this by saying I only use colored pencils for coloring books, so I can’t speak for any drawing use or whatnot. Not sure if I got a bad batch or what, but after reading through reviews on these and a few other brands for weeks, I finally decided on these. Immediately opened them up and shoved the other ones I had been using aside. Almost every pencil that I used though ended up breaking off at least once while coloring and sharpening. I can’t justify the money on these when all they do is break.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda White

customer_reviews.title: Save your money for something better.
customer_reviews.text: I was incredibly disappointed with this purchase. Many of the pencils are useless because when you sharpen them their core is cracked and it just falls out. The warm gray pencil was cracked all the way thru. If you roll the dice then you ABSOLUTLY must get the hand sharpener because an electric one would likely make them unusable.
customer_reviews.author: csloop

customer_reviews.title: FAKE COLOR PENCIL SET
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my daughters art class but one week later I was notified by the art teacher that the set we bought from DOUGLAS MARO was actually fake. It didn’t include the actual colors of the real Prismacolor brand. DO NOT BUY FROM THIS SELLER!
customer_reviews.author: Usha

customer_reviews.title: YEUS!
customer_reviews.text: I love these soft beautiful pencils. I have no idea why people say "If you know how to sharpen them terdlyder" I have a dollar store sharpener and they sharpen like a champ. These are seriously rad pencils, and buying the blender pencil for these is very worth it. Luuuv it
customer_reviews.author: Maomi

customer_reviews.title: Broken pencils
customer_reviews.text: Im really upset. I was trying to decide between these and faber castell 72. I have some faber castell already but really wanted to give these a try because they are cheaper and ive heard great things about the quality. I am very upset that some of my pencils came broken and worn. I would not buy again or recommend to anyone else at least from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: chanettet

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand. It is well worth the price. They blend easily, excellent saturation with hardly any pressure needed to color. They are soft enough to use without smearing and all the colors seem to have the same hardness. With other brands I have bought there are always some colors that are too hard to use. They just tear the paper up. They work well on standard weight and heavier paper and the color goes on evenly for all weights that I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Connie M.

customer_reviews.title: "Thick, robust leads"..... NOT
customer_reviews.text: Just received this pack of extremely thin colored pencils. I've used Prismacolor pencils for 20 years and was surprised at how thin these are. The ad says, "Thick, robust leads".... they are NOT at all thick. In fact they're so thin I doubt I'd be able to hold them for a coloring session, and worse... to sharpen them. They are really thin! Almost worthless if I can't sharpen them frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The colors are dull and the leads break with barely any pressure. I wasted my money
customer_reviews.author: Kathie Coulson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Color and applicability but weak pencil tips that break much too easily and often
customer_reviews.text: Superb for artists. The best quality vis a vis color. We have had an inordinate amount of tip breakage resulting in the requirement to purchase new replacements WAYYY more often than we would like. Expensive to replace individual primarily used colors. Cheaper to buy another entire set rather than just a few depleted pencils. They make a cheaper variety with more robust tips (I think they call them scholastic, bringing to mine school children clutching crayolas in their fist and scribbling on blank paper). Perhaps we should try the cheap ones.
customer_reviews.author: El Dudereeno

customer_reviews.title: They keep breaking.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Prismacolor pencils in the past and never had trouble. This tin of 72 was purchased six months ago and I've never had a set of pencil leads break on me as often as these do. I won't purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Boyer

customer_reviews.title: I love this set
customer_reviews.text: Glorious color, I love this set. Lots of variety, though I could do with some more flesh tones (not white person flesh).
customer_reviews.author: Tammen Chase

customer_reviews.title: Richly Tinted Pencils in a Tin Container
customer_reviews.text: The 72 colored pencils have rich tints, and go on easily without having to push hard. I still dislike those plastic trays the pencils come in, but at least the outside container is tin, not cardboard. I would not have purchased these pencils if they had not been on sale, as I am not a free form artist. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Northern SW

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit Set
customer_reviews.text: The set I received is counterfeit. I’m just now using the pencils, and they are not genuine Prismacolors. I am very angry about this...
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Jennette

customer_reviews.title: Missing colors from set
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived missing three colors 940 Sand, 1023 Sky Blue, and most importantly 935 Black. There were duplicates of three other colors so it did have 72 pencils, just not unique. If I can get those three colors, I will be happy to up my rating because I do love the pencils. I am just disappointed in the incorrect packaging, and especially missing the black pencil.
customer_reviews.author: S G

customer_reviews.title: Quality cannot be beat!
customer_reviews.text: I already had the 24 Prismacolor set, as well as the Manga set and absolutely loved them. My mom bought this 72 set for me for an early Christmas present (she bought herself one as well) and I could not be more pleased. We both love adult coloring books, as well as our own art, and these pencils are perfect for any application. Michael's wants $45.99 for the 24 set and we were able to get 72 for $51.60. Just spectacular
customer_reviews.author: MelissaTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Pencils are great, box layout SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: OK, Prismacolor softcore pencils are actually 5 stars, but this box gets only 4 stars simply because it's so poorly designed for access. You have to take out the wobbly trays of colored pencils without spilling them and then lay them out on a table, if you have the room. I ended up having to just dump all the pencils in the box and dig through them (taking longer) to find the right color. It's a really poor design considering they have other larger sets with a superior layout. Why not use the same layout (for ease of access) with this smaller set?
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J Chandra

customer_reviews.title: Mostly As Described But
customer_reviews.text: The set which arrived was slightly defective. One color was not received; another was duplicated. A few colors were not as labelled. As a novice this was particularly annoying when trying to follow directions in step-by-step tutorials with specified prismacolor colors. I suggest checking the color labels against a web resource (search for prismacolor premier color chart). I have not had problems with broken or cracked wood casing or pigment shafts. For my skill level these colored pencil have performed well.
customer_reviews.author: ThinkerTinkerer

customer_reviews.title: Good pencils, but color mix could be better
customer_reviews.text: This is for the 72 color pack. Its great for the price and the colors are good. However the packing is a problem. Its a tin with three layers. So you need to spread them all out (and occupy all your desk space). I would have liked a pop-out shelf kinda mechanism where all three trays pop out and you can choose the colors you want. Also I feel amateurs dont need so many colors. Many of them look just the same. I would suggest getting a 24 color set and then buy the colors you want from blick :D
customer_reviews.author: Sarvajit

customer_reviews.title: Best Pencils Ever. Easy On Hands
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical and wasted my money on cheaper brands. Never again. The higher quality of these pencils is immediately obvious with the 1st swipe of pencil to paper. I alsl bought the blender pencils suggested and they are the best. My projects now look professional and gorgeous.!! And...because the color lays down so nicely, I do not have to push so hard which is much easier on my hands!! Love these.
customer_reviews.author: kurz04

customer_reviews.title: Prismacolor now has decline in quality.
customer_reviews.text: Pencils will not sharpen evenly, wood is far too hard. Wastes a great deal of pencil. Ubrand is a far better made pencil. Would like a refund but am not given that option.
customer_reviews.author: K. L. L.

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!
customer_reviews.text: If you want to become serious about traditional art, but are wary of spending too much money on colored pencils - trust me, these are worth it. The difference between a professional set of colored pencils and a 100+ pack of Crayola pencils is immense and immediately apparent as soon as you start using these. I don't think I can ever go back to other, cheaper brands now and be satisfied. These pencils are excellent for layering different colors and also blending, and have especially bright pigments on the paper. I love them and will definitely buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: C. McCorvey

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Pencils are badly broken inside. Sorry but I can't review on five stars. The tin has a dent.
customer_reviews.author: Nickole

customer_reviews.title: These are the best pencils anywhere
customer_reviews.text: These are the absolute best color pencils I have ever used. They have a soft core for easy blending and easy application. You don't have to push hard for these pencils because the vibrant colors lay down exactly as they look. They later perfectly to make many different effects. This is the perfect size set for anyone looking to add to their art supplies!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Something New!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a new experience for me considering I have always used crayola colored pencils. I watched YouTube videos on card making ect and seen a few people use these and I was curious so I bought them. You do have to get use to them. It takes time. They key is blending to make the finish product flawless. I LOVE them! My fiancé LIKES them, but its a new and learning experience for me. I love that your able to blend with these. We bought the 72 pack! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Butter
customer_reviews.text: I finally splurged on purchasing colored pencil. And what everyone has said about this product is true! It’s butter! It blends really well. And you don’t need to put too much pressure to get a darker shade. To compare through, this is my first expensive color pencil. So I can’t compare to other expensive brands. I’ve used crayons, Rose art, prang.
customer_reviews.author: Abi

customer_reviews.title: Good pencils, nice laydown, 2 pencils have broken lead.
customer_reviews.text: I got a very good price on the pencils. I like the laydown of color. 3 star because quite a few pencils are not centered and 2 pencils were broken and I lost quite a bit of the pencil because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Janet A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality + comprehensive range of colors
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to myself and I can't believe what a great deal it was. Prismacolors are a very high standard for colored pencils - perfect for those of us who notice the nuances between colored pencil options. The range of colors in this set feels comprehensive. The ability to blend and color vibrancy is excellent and everything you would expect from Prismacolor.
customer_reviews.author: HipChickDigs

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality and not what I would expect
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the pencil is NOT what it should be. Lots of pencils cores are in pieces and most have off center cores. They are not smooth like other prismacolor that I have gotten before. So disappointed. There was also two of the same color and missing a color that should have been there.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Brown

customer_reviews.title: Prismacolor is hard to beat
customer_reviews.text: Prismacolor is one of my favorite pencils - period. And I've used a large variety of colored pencils in my coloring obsession over the past four years. These are nice and soft so you have great control over depth and shading. There are a ton of beautiful colors in this set. It's my go-to set for basic coloring. Oh! And I did the "per piece" price comparison for you - this set is the best value of those offered by Amazon with a per-piece price nearly 30% less than some of the other packaging configurations. Happy coloring!
customer_reviews.author: Asradel

customer_reviews.title: Kept breaking while sharpening
customer_reviews.text: Looks and colors a plus. But what is up with the quality? The black kept breaking when sharpening. Decided to take a picture after a while.
customer_reviews.author: JR

product_meta.title: Prismacolor Premier Colored Pencils, Soft Core, 72 Pack
product_meta.description:
Size:72-Count| Color:Assorted| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingBring out the soft side of any illustration or art project with Prismacolor Premier Colored Pencils featuring soft cores. Inside the box you’ll find 72 colored pencils featuring creamy cores that are the artist’s choice for blending, shading and layering. Prismacolor colored pencils have pigments of unmatched quality and leads that are strong enough to be sharpened to a precision point. That means you can effortlessly switch between powerful lines, delicate blends and silky shadowing.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Designed to handle detailed work for advanced students and artists, these Prismacolor Premier Colored Pencils feature high grade pigments for rich color saturation. Other features include soft, thick cores for superior blending and shading, and a color coded woodcasing for easy identification. The soft cores also resist breaking. Designed with professional artist quality for every level of expertise, these pencils come in an assorted set of 72, and include a convenient tin case.

 What's in the Box
Set of 72 assorted Prismacolor Premier Colored Woodcase Pencils, and tin case.
feature_bullets: Soft, thick cores are perfect for shading and shadows
Ultra smooth, even color lay down
Thick, robust leads resist cracking and chipping
Artist quality colored pencils for every level of expertise
Colors are easily blended, slow to wear and waterproof
Soft, thick cores create a smooth color laydown for superior blending and shading
Package contains one 9 3/4 by 8 1/8 by 1 1/8 inches tin with 72 pencils

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars27,317 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
